availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis M. Shea (Louisville, Kentucky, soldier, tobacconist and bricklayer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, soldier, tobacconist, and bricklayer. Ohio native. Married to Elizabeth Farley Shea in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on June 2, 1851. Father of Emma Shea, William Shea, Sarah Shea, and Susan Shea. Served in the U.S-Mexico War in the 4th Artillery as a private from May 18, 1847, to May 4, 1848. Tobacconist in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Bricklayer in Louisville in 1860. Bricklayer in Louisville in 1861. Bricklayer in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
